Reduced income inequality: Access to education would be more equal, leading to a more level playing field for individuals from all backgrounds, reducing income inequality.
Improved health outcomes: Educated individuals are more likely to make healthy choices, leading to improved health outcomes and reduced healthcare costs.
Increased political engagement: Educated individuals are more likely to be politically engaged, leading to better-informed decisions and more effective governance.
Enhanced cultural understanding: Free, high-quality education would promote cross-cultural understanding and tolerance, reducing prejudice and promoting social harmony.
Increased innovation: Educated individuals are more likely to be innovative, leading to new ideas, products, and services that drive economic growth and improve people's lives.
